snippet: Far more than his predecessors, China’s president has reached back into a rich trove of ancient statecraft for vindication and guidance.
abstract: Chinese Pres Xi Jinping often seeks to justify his policies by invoking Mencius and other ancient thinkers; People's Daily published in March a selection of 76 of Xi's quotes from Chinese ancients, most often Confucius and Mencius, but also relatively obscure works that suggest leader's deeper knowledge of classics.
lead_paragraph: Far more than his predecessors, China’s president has reached back into a rich trove of ancient statecraft for vindication and guidance.

headline.main: Leader Taps Into Chinese Classics in Seeking to Cement Power
headline.print_headline: Leader Taps Into Chinese Classics in Seeking to Cement Power
